Record Class CaptureConfig

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Record
ca.gc.cra.radar.config.CaptureConfig
Record Components:
iface - network interface name to capture from
pcapFile - offline capture file when provided
filter - active BPF filter expression (sanitized)
customBpfEnabled - true when a custom BPF expression was explicitly enabled
protocol - capture protocol hint for default filtering
snaplen - libpcap snap length in bytes
bufferBytes - capture buffer size in bytes
timeoutMillis - polling timeout in milliseconds
promiscuous - whether to enable promiscuous mode
immediate - whether to request immediate mode from libpcap
outputDirectory - directory for persisted segment files in file mode
fileBase - filename prefix for rotated segment files
rollMiB - maximum file size before rotation (mebibytes)
httpOutputDirectory - directory for HTTP poster artifacts
tn3270OutputDirectory - directory for TN3270 poster artifacts
ioMode - capture persistence mode (IoMode.FILE or IoMode.KAFKA)
kafkaBootstrap - Kafka bootstrap servers (required for Kafka mode)
kafkaTopicSegments - Kafka topic for segments in Kafka mode
persistenceWorkers - number of persistence workers for live processing
persistenceQueueCapacity - capacity of the live persistence queue
persistenceQueueType - queue implementation used for live persistence hand-off
public record CaptureConfig(String iface, Path pcapFile, String filter, boolean customBpfEnabled, CaptureProtocol protocol, int snaplen, int bufferBytes, int timeoutMillis, boolean promiscuous, boolean immediate, Path outputDirectory, String fileBase, int rollMiB, Path httpOutputDirectory, Path tn3270OutputDirectory, IoMode ioMode, String kafkaBootstrap, String kafkaTopicSegments, int persistenceWorkers, int persistenceQueueCapacity, CaptureConfig.PersistenceQueueType persistenceQueueType) extends Record
Configuration for the capture CLI, covering NIC selection, IO modes, and file rotation.
Since:
RADAR 0.1-doc

    • equals

      public final boolean equals(Object o)
      Indicates whether some other object is "equal to" this one. The objects are equal if the other object is of the same class and if all the record components are equal. Reference components are compared with Objects::equals(Object,Object); primitive components are compared with the compare method from their corresponding wrapper classes.
      Specified by:
      equals in class Record
      Parameters:
      o - the object with which to compare
      Returns:
      true if this object is the same as the o argument; false otherwise.
